conclusion: To solve the problem, analyze the image to determine the flow path of the liquid as it passes through the baffles and into either container E or F.

The image depicts a setup with baffles and containers labeled E and F. Liquid is shown to flow out from sources labeled A, B, C, and D. These sources are connected by channels that guide the liquid through the baffles.
Sources of liquid are labeled A, B, C, and D.
Baffles are arranged such that channels from A and C lead towards container F, while channels from B and D lead towards container E.
Liquid from sources A and C will flow down the channel leading to container F.
Liquid from sources B and D will flow into container E.
Combining observations, liquid from sources A and C will continue into container F, and liquid from sources B and D will flow into container E.
The final destination of the liquid is container E.
